chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
hello. yes
cool! i'm at the starting point
i see a twig to my left leading to a small island and there's a tiger on it. where should i go from here?
good, go towards the tiger, just south of it
okay, heading south
there's a butterfly on a smaller island in the southeast and a larger island with a parrot on a tree in the southwest. where to now homes?
go northwest towards the tiger
aii, heading northwest towards the tiger
now what friend?
go west through the twig towards the parrot and go above it, then down through the space between it and the elephant
alrightyo, heading west to the parrot, squeezing between it and the elephant
now go northeast and go across the bridge made of stones towards the frog
okay, heading northeast across the stone bridge to the frog, got it!
then go south and then southeast to just after the lower end of the frog
aight, going south then southeast just past the frog's lower end, done!
then do a u turn there and go northwest towards the crocodile bridge
okay, u-turn and heading northwest to the crocodile bridge, gotcha!
go through it and through the black rock, then west towards the stone bridge leading to the giraffe island
through the croc bridge and black rock, then west to the stone bridge to giraffe island, on the way now!
now go south and enter the bridge towards the snake
south and onto the bridge towards the snake
done!
then go east through the snake towards the treasure and you'll have finished the route
heading east through the snake towards the treasure, let's go! *finished*
hola, q tal? ready to play?
Yes
awesome! spot the wooden bench on your left, and move a few steps towards it. don't reach it though, make a u-turn before that, just when you cross a small trail
head back towards the white dog. got it?
done, just south of the white dog noww
alright, good job! now, move southwards over the branch and keep heading down
you should see another white dog near a checkered picnic mat. head towards it
okay , going
great! now step onto the mat, brushing against a bowl of berries
keep moving till you head west
okay, now do i go west from here or elsewhere?
perfect! now head towards the river and cross it by treading over the wooden branch that's lying right in front of you
go in the direction of north, okay?
okay
once you've crossed the river, you're almost there! just circle the green bush to your right, but don't touch it
got it?
okay, i'm just northeast of it, what now?
good job! move towards the florist stand, but don't stop just yet!
okay, done, I'm just south of it
awesome! now head left and duck below the florist stand, you're doing great!
done
alright, spot the big bridge with the folks riding their bikes
skirt past it to the west and halt shortly after you pass it. let me know when you're there!
done
perfect. just south of you, are two folks sitting on a bench reading
steer few steps south between them and the branch. you should be able to spot a green bush by the end of the branch. can you see it?
yes, i can
awesome! navigate east, remaining between the branch and the bush
okay, i'm just west of the deer, where do i go now?
you've done splendidly! take the last few steps east, and there you have it: the sweet young deer
well done, friend!
hola, q tal? ready to start?
yes. where are you located now?
i'm at the north, in a tent
which way do i go?
go straight south, then keep going squeezing in between the dog and the rock bed
alright, passed the dog
i see a fire and a mushroom. which way now?

go east towards the mushroom while circling around the fire by going through it and the dog and then to the front of it between the fire and the mushroom. Then head southeast through the trail towards the car
alrighty, circled the fire, avoided stepping on the pupper, and now i'm at the mushroom
heading southeast now, got the blue car in sight! what's next mate?
do a u turn to get back on the north-south trail, and head southeast through it towards the east end of the telescope
roger that! made the u-turn and i'm now standing at the east end of the telescope
where to next, cap'n?
squeeze southwards between the tree and the telescope and reach the trail back again, and then head west on the trail
done, tree and telescope squeezed
i'm back on the trail, heading west now
now go northwest through the river of rocks right towards the wooden house. reach the wooden house and you're done
gotcha! navigating through the river of rocks, heading northwest
okay, now get to the wooden house
woohoo! reached the wooden house
*finished* this was fun my mate, ready for another round or we are done for the day?
hola, q tal? ready to go?
hello, yes i am
awesome! first, walk under the first palm tree towards south-west, then make a sharp right, going past the second tree and before the third one, look left and head south
got it?
yes, now im just west of the dog
cool! you're doing a good job
now, head slightly left, and then makes a direct right turn to the south. keep rocking it, friend!
okay, i'm on the east edge of the largest rock, what now?
nice progress! now, head straight between these two rocks and you'll reach the ocean
you're doing smashing!
okay, now im just north of the crab
great work! time for a sea adventure
don't worry about the crab, he's friendly! now, take a right, westwards, follow the big rock, stay cool in the water
okay i'm at the southwest end of the largest rock, where to now?
that's it, mate! now, slide past a medium rock, you'll see a shark in the water
make a sharp turn to the right when you do. remember, sharks are less scary than they look!
okay, now i'm just south of the ball
groovy! now, shoot the gap back onto land between the medium rock and the colorful ball, then go north
keep it up, champ!
got it. now i'm just south of the speaker
amazing! now, head slightly left, navigating between that red tent to your left and the big speaker to your right
up we go, buddy!
done. now where to?
excellent work! now, curve around the red tent and start heading south towards the sea again
keep in mind, we aren't going for a dip this time!
okay, done. now i'm northeast of a boat
perfect! now, make a right, and stroll right under that red kayak, heading westwards
you're doing great, keep it up!
okay i'm just south of it now
fantastic! now, turn sharp right, walk along the kayak and there you'll see a cute small green bush
you are almost there, pal!

general_survey.answer: yes. here in the US as it is the main language spoken here
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
Do you speak any additional languages? If so, please describe briefly here.
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both English and Spanish?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
When you hear others mixing languages in conversation, how do you feel about it?
How natural was your conversational partner’s language switching?
Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: i speak english the most nowadays, then portuguese which is my original language, and spanish in a few occasions when needed
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
